abstract: Memo from Europe; traditional two-party politics are unraveling all over Europe, giving rise to coalition governments and increased influence of alternative parties as voters lose faith in governments to deliver economic growth and security; coalitions, however, present their own problems and often do not satisfy voters looking for true alternative.
lead_paragraph: When the returns are in from the British elections, Britons may once again have a weak government or a coalition, in keeping with a broader pattern.

headline.main: As Europe’s Political Landscape Shifts, Two-Party System Fades
headline.print_headline: As Europe’s Political Landscape Shifts, Two-Party System Fades

snippet: When the returns are in from the British elections, Britons may once again have a weak government or a coalition, in keeping with a broader pattern.
